name: Nana's Homemade Chocolate Pudding
author: Chelsea Wagner
summary: A rich, silky homemade chocolate pudding made the same way in our family since the 50's. Cooled pudding will form a dark skin on top, which is our favorite part! Top with whipped cream, if desired.
directions: Sift and whisk sugar, cocoa powder, cornstarch, and salt together in a saucepan
Pour milk in slowly, whisking constantly until incorporated
Cook, stirring often with a metal spoon, until pudding is noticeably thicker and clings to the spoon, about 10 minutes
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract
Divide between 4 small bowls and serve immediately, or chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours
